element.name: Ruhrgebiet meets Naas by GaGa-Team, Traditional Cache (2/1.5)
element.long-description:
Visiting Naas from the Ruhrgebiet in faraway Germany we decided this charming place deserved its first own cache. The cache is a drive in and located between Tandy's bridge and Osberstown bridge, right next to the canal.
If you have the time, follow the quiet canal to the south west, and after about 1 km you will reach the centre of Naas. A stroll through the town with its colourful pubs and storefronts and the remains of St. David's castle is definitely worth its while! For more info see www.naas.ie. If you want to find out more about our hometown Essen, check out www.essen.de
Be extra careful when you retrieve the cache and PRETTY PLEASE! rehide it exactly as it is hidden since otherwise it may wind up in the water. And so may you or the next cacher. ;-) Have fun now! 09.10.2009: This cache had already been archived. Many thanks to NaasPreacher who offered to take care of it, so it can now be found again.
contents:
1 small book
1 piece of coal in a pouch
1 patch
1 bag of lucky charms
1 wall hanging
1 log book
1 pen
element.encoded-hints: on a ledge under wooden platform

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by RosMcC
No luck here, searched for quite a while. Everything was wet and slippery in the pouring rain, so was wary of getting even wetter in the canal!

2010-06-04T19:00:00Z : Found it by Antefix
To SEE the cache was one thing. But the get it in our hands... not exactly terrain 1,5 one would say. Anyway, we found it, logged it, replaced it (exactly the way we have found it, as the listing says...) and did not get wet.
Danke für den Cache und Grüsse ins Ruhrgebiet aus der Schweiz

2010-06-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by anice77
2010-06-03 14:15 Uhr Found this cache at my vacation and caching trip in Irland. [b]Thx a lot for this cool location.Thanks for this cache which is my find [red]#2740#[/red] anice77

2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Nice hide [:D] Found it no problems, lovely part of town. TFTC, Spark_ie [:)]

2010-05-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by BlueFoxPL
Another great day for caching... found with some friends. TFTC.

wpt.name: GCWVM3
wpt.desc: Ruhrgebiet meets Naas by GaGa-Team, Traditional Cache (2/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Ruhrgebiet meets Naas
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Visiting Naas from the Ruhrgebiet in faraway Germany we decided this charming place deserved its first own cache. The cache is a drive in and located between Tandy's bridge and Osberstown bridge, right next to the canal.
If you have the time, follow the quiet canal to the south west, and after about 1 km you will reach the centre of Naas. A stroll through the town with its colourful pubs and storefronts and the remains of St. David's castle is definitely worth its while! For more info see www.naas.ie. If you want to find out more about our hometown Essen, check out www.essen.de





Be extra careful when you retrieve the cache and PRETTY PLEASE! rehide it exactly as it is hidden since otherwise it may wind up in the water. And so may you or the next cacher. ;-) Have fun now!

09.10.2009: This cache had already been archived. Many thanks to NaasPreacher who offered to take care of it, so it can now be found again.

contents:

1 small book
1 piece of coal in a pouch
1 patch
1 bag of lucky charms
1 wall hanging
1 log book
1 pen
